bestBHT.bht: Pray that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be glorified, running swiftly through the world with no hindrances. Let it be acknowledged in its true power and glory, bringing forth fruit. The ministry of the word is like a race, and the gospel is glorified when heard with reverence. Therefore, let us pray not only for our reception of the word, but also for the courage and constancy of those who proclaim it, that it may attain its rightful position in the minds of people everywhere.

Henry Alford: The word of the Lord is then glorified, when it becomes the power of God to salvation to the believer.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: That the new-creating word may 'run,' as 'swiftly' as the creative word at the first.
Albert Barnes: That the word of the Lord may have free course...with the rapidity of a racer out of whose way every hindrance was removed.
The gospel would spread rapidly in the earth if all the obstructions which men have put in its way were removed.
Be glorified...and appear to be glorious.
Marvin Vincent: May have free course [τρεχη]. More literally, simply, and better, may run. Have swift progress through the world."
Be glorified [δοξαζηται]. Acknowledged in its true power and glory.
The phrase the word of the Lord - be glorified, only here.
John Calvin: He does not desire, therefore, so much that regard should be had to himself individually, as to the glory of God and the common welfare of the Church."
Course means here dissemination; glory means something farther, — that his preaching may have its power and efficacy for renewing men after the image of God."
Hence, holiness of life and uprightness on the part of Christians is the glory of the gospel.
Philip Schaff: He not only prays for his ‘children’ in Christ, but begs them to pray for him.
Paul felt his need of courage to race those who opposed the preaching of the Gospel, of constancy to avail himself of every opportunity to introduce it into new audiences.
Paul desires that it may elsewhere be similarly glorified, attaining its rightful position in men’s minds.
Archibald T. Robertson: Pray, that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified.
He needs their prayers and sympathy and he rejoices in their reception of the word of the Lord already.
John Gill: That the word of the Lord may have free course."
The ministry of the word is a course or race, and ministers are runners in it."
The Gospel is glorified when it is attended upon by large numbers, and is heard with a becoming reverence.
John Wesley: May run — Go on swiftly, without any interruption.
And be glorified — Acknowledged as divine, and bring forth much fruit.

bhtAttempts.bht: Pray that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be glorified, as it has with you. May it have a triumphant career, running swiftly and freely through the world, with no hindrances to obstruct its progress. Let it be acknowledged in its true power and glory, bringing forth much fruit and being seen as divine. The ministry of the word is like a race, and the gospel is glorified when it is received by many and heard with reverence. Therefore, let us pray not only for our own reception of the word, but also for the courage and constancy of those who proclaim it, that it may attain its rightful position in the minds of people everywhere.
